name: Pagination

props.name: onChange
props.description: Called with **new page** when user clicks.

props.name: visibleWindow
props.description:
Limit how many page buttons are visible at once. When set and less than `count`,
pagination renders a sliding window of page numbers plus window scroll controls.
Does not affect the currently selected page.

props.name: autoFollowActive
props.description:
If true, forces the active page to remain visible by auto-shifting the window
whenever `page` changes outside the current window. Defaults to true.

props.name: preset
props.description: One or many style-preset names registered via `definePreset()`

bestPractices: Keep visible pages small. For large `count`, set a reasonable `siblingCount` and rely on first/last controls.
Sync state when relevant. Mirror page in the router (query or path) so refresh/back behaves predictably.
Prefer server‑side slicing for large datasets; ensure Table or List reflects the current page cleanly.
Use accessible labels and titles for buttons (Prev/Next) and indicate current page to assistive tech.
Consider infinite scroll for content feeds where paging is less meaningful.
Align placement near the data it controls and avoid duplicating controls unless justified.
